intro: Scholtzia longipedata, commonly known as the long-stemmed scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and inland deserts. Scholtzia longipedata is known for its drought tolerance and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
